siteMetadata.title: Deno First Look
siteMetadata.subtitle: An introduction to the Deno JavaScript runtime
siteMetadata.description: An introduction to the Deno JavaScript runtime
keywords: a list of keywords and phrase

frontmatter.title: Introduction
frontmatter.description: Burke covers the agenda for the Deno First Look workshop, talks about himself a little bit more than you would probably like, explains how to submit issues with this course and then pontificates on whether or not Deno is something that has a future and if we should be investing valuable time into learning it.

frontmatter.title: Why
frontmatter.description: Why oh why do we need another JavaScript runtime?

frontmatter.title: Secure By Default
frontmatter.description: Deno runtime is secure by default. This is in stark contrast to how Node works today, and it's important to understand why so that Deno's default locked down state doesn't feel so oppressive.

frontmatter.title: Dependency Hell
frontmatter.description: Burke looks at what the current state of dependencies in Node.js is, and why Deno has a fundamentally different approach.

frontmatter.title: TypeScript First
frontmatter.description: Burke talks about why TypeScript plays an enormous role in how Deno thinks about how applications should be built.

frontmatter.title: Installing Deno
frontmatter.description: Burke covers how to install Deno, and takes a look at the Deno CLI, REPL and what options you need to be aware of.

frontmatter.title: Tooling
frontmatter.description: Burke covers how to install Deno, and takes a look at the Deno CLI, REPL and what options you need to be aware of.

frontmatter.title: The Deno object
frontmatter.description: Burke looks at how to pass arguments and flags to the Deno CLI

frontmatter.title: Your first program
frontmatter.description: Burke goes over how to write your first program with Deno and execute it with the Deno CLI.

frontmatter.title: CLI Tour
frontmatter.description: Burke looks at how to pass arguments and flags to the Deno CLI

frontmatter.title: Debugging
frontmatter.description: Burke looks at how to debug Deno apps

frontmatter.title: Thinking like a browser
frontmatter.description: Burke dives into how Deno handles dependencies.
